trans-unit.source: Specifies the search filter to use to determine what constitutes a user (and other search predicate) for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> searches for a full DN during user authentication.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the search filter to use to determine what constitutes a user (and other search predicate) for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> searches for a full DN during user authentication.

target.mrk: Specifies the search filter to use to determine what constitutes a user (and other search predicate) for <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> searches for a full DN during user authentication.

trans-unit.source: If you set this property to derby.user, looks for cached full DNs for users that you have defined with the derby.user.UserName property. For other users, performs a search using the default search filter.

seg-source.mrk: If you set this property to derby.user, looks for cached full DNs for users that you have defined with the derby.user.UserName property.
For other users, performs a search using the default search filter.

target.mrk: If you set this property to derby.user, looks for cached full DNs for users that you have defined with the derby.user.UserName property.
For other users, performs a search using the default search filter.

trans-unit.source: For more information about LDAP user authentication, see "LDAP directory service" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information about LDAP user authentication, see "LDAP directory service" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information about LDAP user authentication, see "LDAP directory service" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: automatically uses the filter you specify with ((uid=userName)) unless you include %USERNAME% in the definition. You might want to use %USERNAME% if your user DNs map the user name to something other than uid (for example, user).

seg-source.mrk: automatically uses the filter you specify with ((uid=userName)) unless you include %USERNAME% in the definition.
You might want to use %USERNAME% if your user DNs map the user name to something other than uid (for example, user).

target.mrk: automatically uses the filter you specify with ((uid=userName)) unless you include %USERNAME% in the definition.
You might want to use %USERNAME% if your user DNs map the user name to something other than uid (for example, user).

trans-unit.source: -- system-wide properties derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=objectClass=person ## people in the marketing department ## automatically adds (uid=) derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&(ou=Marketing) (objectClass=person)) ## all people but those in marketing ## automatically adds (uid=) derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&(!(ou=Marketing) (objectClass=person)) ## map %USERNAME% to user, not uid derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&((ou=People) (user=%USERNAME%)) ## cache user DNs locally and use the default for others derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=derby.user -- database-wide property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter', 'objectClass=person')

seg-source.mrk: -- system-wide properties derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=objectClass=person ## people in the marketing department ## automatically adds (uid=) derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&(ou=Marketing) (objectClass=person)) ## all people but those in marketing ## automatically adds (uid=) derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&(!(ou=Marketing) (objectClass=person)) ## map %USERNAME% to user, not uid derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&((ou=People) (user=%USERNAME%)) ## cache user DNs locally and use the default for others derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=derby.user -- database-wide property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter', 'objectClass=person')

target.mrk: -- system-wide properties derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=objectClass=person ## people in the marketing department ## automatically adds (uid=) derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&(ou=Marketing) (objectClass=person)) ## all people but those in marketing ## automatically adds (uid=) derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&(!(ou=Marketing) (objectClass=person)) ## map %USERNAME% to user, not uid derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=(&((ou=People) (user=%USERNAME%)) ## cache user DNs locally and use the default for others derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter=derby.user -- database-wide property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.ldap.searchFilter', 'objectClass=person')

trans-unit.source: Static. For system-wide properties, you must reboot <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for the change to take effect. For database-wide properties, you must reboot the database for the change to take effect.

seg-source.mrk: For system-wide properties, you must reboot <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for the change to take effect.
For database-wide properties, you must reboot the database for the change to take effect.

target.mrk: For system-wide properties, you must reboot <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> for the change to take effect.
For database-wide properties, you must reboot the database for the change to take effect.
